item.content:encoded: BREAKING: employee of Va. GOP contractor arrested for destroying voter registration forms http://t.co/JnR61j2I A Pennsylvania man employed by a company working for the Republican Party of Virginia was arrested by investigators from the Rockingham County Sheriff‚Äôs office on Thursday and charged with destroying voter registration forms. item.title: Katy Perry, Jodi DiPiazza Sing at Night of Too Many Stars
item.description: http://t.co/MrGwdzll
item.content:encoded: http://t.co/MrGwdzll To help give people with autism the chance they deserve to reach their potential go to http://cc.com/donate or text STARS to 50555 to donate $10. Night of Too Many Stars airs Sunday, October 21 at 8/7c on Comedy Central. Katy Perry and Jodi DiPiazza sing "Firework" at the Beacon Theater in New York. "Night of Too Many Stars: America Comes Together for Autism Programs" is hosted by Jon Stewart and raises money for autism programs, schools, and services all over the country. Performers include Tina Fey, Seth Rogen, Amy Poehler, Stephen Colbert, Louis CK, Bill Burr, Katy Perry, Carly Rae Jepsen, Tom Morello, Sting and many more. Sunday night's live celebrity phone bank includes Tom Hanks, Jerry Seinfeld, Julianne Moore, Seth Meyers, Jimmy Kimmel, and Al Pacino. For more highlight previews go to http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLD7nPL1U-R5oQRBMDHXwFM1srbI-Smmqm Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: youtube.com

item.title: Gallup vs. the World
item.description: NYT 538 Blog: Gallup vs. the World: The Gallup national tracking poll now shows a very strong lead for Mitt Romn... http://t.co/UFTfSo7b
item.content:encoded: NYT 538 Blog: Gallup vs. the World: The Gallup national tracking poll now shows a very strong lead for Mitt Romn... http://t.co/UFTfSo7b The Gallup national tracking poll now shows a very strong lead for Mitt Romney. However, its results are deeply inconsistent with the results that other polling firms are showing in the presidential race, and the Gallup poll has a history of performing very poorly when that is the case. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: nytimes.com

item.description: New PA poll has Romney ahead by 4, but Romney's recent 9 state ad buy did not include PA. I say it's an outlier. #RttWH http://t.co/Oh8HyuxC
item.content:encoded: New PA poll has Romney ahead by 4, but Romney's recent 9 state ad buy did not include PA. I say it's an outlier. #RttWH http://t.co/Oh8HyuxC A new poll shows Republican Mitt Romney leading in Pennsylvania, a state that Republicans had all but written off just weeks ago but which is now listed as a toss up by the Real Clear Politics website. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: washingtonexaminer.com

item.title: Media Suddenly Muted on Jobless Claims
item.description: Media Suddenly Muted on Jobless Claims http://t.co/j64LVQoM via @BreitbartNews
item.content:encoded: Media Suddenly Muted on Jobless Claims http://t.co/j64LVQoM via @BreitbartNews Last Thursday morning, the headlines on National Public Radio were jubilant. "Jobless Claims Drop To Lowest Level In More Than Four Years," they crowed. This week, jobless claims have soared to 388,000. Imagine if there were a conservative equivalent to NPR. The headlines this morning would have been full of dire conclusions of economic decline under Obama. But there is no media outlet that twists the truth to the right as much as NPR and other mainstream outlets twist it to the left. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: breitbart.com

item.title: Twitter Censors Users for the First Time
item.description: Twitter Censors Users for the First Time: For the first time ever, Twitter censored a controversial account at t... http://t.co/yN2PQAoE
item.content:encoded: Twitter Censors Users for the First Time: For the first time ever, Twitter censored a controversial account at t... http://t.co/yN2PQAoE From Yahoo! News: For the first time ever, Twitter censored a controversial account at the request of local government earlier this week. It was run by neo-Nazis. The ban, which is the first of its kind under a relatively new Twitter policy that gives the company "the ability to reactively withhold content from users in a specific country -- while keeping it available in the rest of the world." As such, the ban¬†is only effective in Germany, however. The rest of the world is free to follow the bigots. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: news.yahoo.com

item.title: Romney says Obama also has investments in Chinese companies and through a Cayman Islands trust
item.description: PolitiFactWisc - Mitt Romney: Says Barack Obama has pension investments that include Chinese firms... http://t.co/uytNVops #wipolitics
item.content:encoded: PolitiFactWisc - Mitt Romney: Says Barack Obama has pension investments that include Chinese firms... http://t.co/uytNVops #wipolitics One of the many tense moments in the second presidential debate turned on a new topic in the race: President Barack Obama‚Äôs pension account. Here‚Äôs how it came up: Early in the face-off, Obama scoffed at Mitt Romney‚Äôs pledge to crack down on unfair trading practices by China, saying Romney is currently invested in companies "that are building surveillance equipment for China to spy on its own folks." Romney later explained that, yes, he understands that his blind trust has invested in foreign firms, including companies in China. Then he confronted Obama. Romney: "Mr. President, have you looked at your ... Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: politifact.com

item.title: Seen - Obama for America TV Ad
item.description: New Obama TV ad "Seen" on abortion http://t.co/y1MHI003
item.content:encoded: New Obama TV ad "Seen" on abortion http://t.co/y1MHI003 Share this: http://OFA.BO/oJXYgT Tweet this: http://OFA.BO/5153qg Voiceover: "Seen this from Mitt Romney? Then take a look at this:" Anderson Cooper: "If Roe v. Wade was overturned, Congress passed a federal ban on all abortions, and it came to your desk -- would you sign it? 'Yes', or 'no?'" Mitt Romney: "Let me say it: I'd be delighted to sign that bill." Voiceover: "Banning all abortions?" Mitt Romney: "I'd be delighted to sign that bill." Voiceover: "Trying to mislead us? That's wrong. But ban all abortions? Only...if you vote for him." Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: youtube.com

item.title: Killed Soldier Warned Obama's Afghanistan Strategy Needlessly Endangering Troops
item.description: Killed Soldier Warned Obama's Afghanistan Strategy Needlessly Endangering Troops http://t.co/vJ2YKDYZ via @BreitbartNews
item.content:encoded: Killed Soldier Warned Obama's Afghanistan Strategy Needlessly Endangering Troops http://t.co/vJ2YKDYZ via @BreitbartNews SSG Sitton's mother says her son told her that he and his men were given a certain amount of foot patrols they had to perform in such areas over a certain amount of time. She recalled he said they frequently had to "patrol in urine and feces soaked uniforms" just to meet the foot-patrol quota -- but no clear objective or end for the patrols was ever given. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: breitbart.com

item.title: Romney Reportedly Earned Millions From Auto Bailout He Opposed
item.description: Mitt Romney Profited By At Least $15.3 Million From Auto Bailout: Report - Huffington Post http://t.co/eOVvIIMt
item.content:encoded: Mitt Romney Profited By At Least $15.3 Million From Auto Bailout: Report - Huffington Post http://t.co/eOVvIIMt Mitt Romney, who famously authored an op-ed in 2008 suggesting that the federal government should "let Detroit go bankrupt," has been on the defensive in the Midwest ever since President Barack Obama's controversial auto bailout turned the struggling companies around. Political observers roundly agree that Romney's opposition to federal intervention may very well cost him Ohio and therefore the White House. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com

item.title: Welfare spending jumps 32% in four years
item.description: Welfare spending jumps 32 percent in four years - Washington Times: http://t.co/cmn7FcNz via @washtimes
item.content:encoded: Welfare spending jumps 32 percent in four years - Washington Times: http://t.co/cmn7FcNz via @washtimes Welfare spending has grown substantially over the past four years, reaching $746 billion in 2011 ‚Äî or more than Social Security, basic defense spending or any other single chunk of the federal government ‚Äî according to a new memo by the Congressional Research Service. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: washingtontimes.com

item.title: Romney opens up 6-point lead over Obama as campaigns hunker down in swing states
item.description: Romney opens up 6-point lead over Obama as campaigns hunker down in swing states http://t.co/a2nKPO3L #tcot #p2 #fem2
item.content:encoded: Romney opens up 6-point lead over Obama as campaigns hunker down in swing states http://t.co/a2nKPO3L #tcot #p2 #fem2 Mitt Romney opened up his biggest lead yet in a national Gallup survey, with the latest results showing the Republican nominee up 6 points over President Obama -- with less than three weeks and just one debate left on the calendar before Election Day. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: foxnews.com

item.title: State Dept Spokeswoman Refuses All Questions on Libya
item.description: State Dept Spokeswoman Refuses All Questions on Libya http://t.co/6Rdx2KIP #Politics
item.content:encoded: State Dept Spokeswoman Refuses All Questions on Libya http://t.co/6Rdx2KIP #Politics This week, the Libya question has been first and foremost on the minds of the American public ‚Äì especially after Secretary of State Hillary Clinton said she took responsibility for security at our embassies, then threw her own security staff under the bus; especially after President Obama sent out minions to take responsibility for security in Benghazi; especially after the Sunday shows were replete with recriminations on the Benghazi situation. So how many questions did the State Department answer about Libya on Monday and Tuesday during their daily press briefings?Zero. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: breitbart.com

item.title: Media Ignores Dozens of Post-Debate Death Threats Against Romney
item.description: Media Ignores Dozens of Post-Debate Death Threats Against Romney http://t.co/1L18NjnG via @BreitbartNews
item.content:encoded: Media Ignores Dozens of Post-Debate Death Threats Against Romney http://t.co/1L18NjnG via @BreitbartNews Man alive, can you imagine the media reaction if in 2008 Obama was thisclose to winning the presidency and dozens of citizens made public death threats against him? Between the tweets collected at Twitchy and Info Wars, the Secret Service will have plenty to keep them busy for the next few weeks. But the media has shown no interest whatsoever in what is a legitimate story. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: breitbart.com

item.content:encoded: Verizon Sold 651,000 iPhone 5s Last Quarter http://t.co/NwM8kVQ1 Verizon reported activating 3.1 million iPhones in the third quarter, 21% of which were the newest model, for a grand total of 651,000 iPhone 5 devices. Link - Trackbacks

item.title: 'Alcoholic' Sells Wife For $110 To Pay For Booze
item.description: Hmmm, idea? Lol ‚Äú@HuffPostWorld: 'Alcoholic' sells wife for $110 to pay for booze http://t.co/ZS7MP6PY‚Äù
item.content:encoded: Hmmm, idea? Lol ‚Äú@HuffPostWorld: 'Alcoholic' sells wife for $110 to pay for booze http://t.co/ZS7MP6PY‚Äù A 42-year-old Indian man described as an "alcoholic" allegedly attempted to sell his wife for about $110 to pay for his drinking habit, the Times of India reports. The newspaper writes that Medula Rajender of Karimnagar, Andhra Pradesh, was reportedly arrested Monday following a complaint lodged by his eldest son. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com

item.title: Arizona County Tells Spanish Speaking Voters To Vote On Wrong Date
item.description: Arizona County Tells Spanish Speaking Voters To Vote On Wrong Date: Maricopa County, Arizona, the home of anti-L... http://t.co/ldsL7I9s
item.content:encoded: Arizona County Tells Spanish Speaking Voters To Vote On Wrong Date: Maricopa County, Arizona, the home of anti-L... http://t.co/ldsL7I9s Arizona County Tells Spanish Speaking Voters To Vote On Wrong Date | Maricopa County, Arizona, the home of anti-Latino Sheriff Joe Arpaio, attached to voter registration cards a document that falsely claimed in Spanish that the general election will take place on November 8th. An English translation lists the correct date, November 6th. The county claims that they caught the mistake early, and the erroneous document was distributed to less than 50 people: Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: thinkprogress.org
